addcube.desc: The x, y, z position must be specified and must be of type integer.

del.desc: The x, y, z position must be specified when deleting a cube. If there is not a cube at this position, a warning will be given.

addcubeset.desc: The x, y, z position of the starting cube must be specified and must be of type integer. Dimensions sx, sy, sz are also integers that represent the dimensions of the cube set. The top corner cube diagonally opposite of the starting cube will have position x + sx, y + sy, z + sz.
addcubeset.example: addcubeset x y z sx sy sz

delcubeset.desc: The x, y, z position of the starting cube must be specified and must be of type integer. Dimensions sx, sy, sz are also integers that represent the dimensions of the cube set. The top corner cube diagonally opposite of the starting cube will have position x + sx, y + sy, z + sz.
delcubeset.example: delcubeset x y z sx sy sz

save.desc: Save the currently open file by passing in the filename (without the .slice extension) and optionally the path to the directory where the file is located.
save.example:
save filename [path_to_directory]

For example, the first command below command will save file "testfile1.slice" to the current working directory. The second command will save "testfile2.slice" to a given directory.

save testfile1
save testfile2 d:\Users\my_name\Documents\Projects

load.desc: Loading a previously saved model with file extension .slice requires the path (relative or absolute) to the file. An optional second argument 'f' or 'false' can be given to not clear the currently loaded model. This can be useful if you want to combine different models.

clear.desc: Will clear current model from the display.

addmodel.desc: Creates a copy of a model file at a specified position.

submodel.desc: Subtracts a designfile from the current design at a specified position. Could be used as a configurable eraser.

slice.desc: Generates a .gcode file for the specified design file. If a design file is not specified, a .gcode file is generated for the current design. The gcode file can be used to print the model on a 3D printer.

undo.desc: Reverses the actions of the previous command.

move.desc: Moves the model along the x, y, and z axes by specified offsets.

rotate.desc: Performs 2D rotation on the XY plane by 90, 180, or 270 degrees (or negative) about a set point (default x=y=0).

setbound.desc: Sets the boundary of your model to avoid accidentally adding cubes outside of the intended boundary.
setbound.example: setbound min_x min_y min_z max_x max_y max_z

addsupport.desc: Creates a support element at a specified position.

slicerprop.example:
slicerprop position x y
slicerprop speed 1000
slicerprop extrusion 0.5
slicerprop infill 1.0
slicerprop layerHeight 1.0
